page.topic: Preventing an Event From Firing Twice

section.description: Sometimes an object's event will fire more than once. If this causes your code to run more than once, the following strategy will fix the problem. In your autoexec script add the following code.
section.example: dim global busy as L busy = .f.

section.description: Then add this code at the top of the object's OnArrive event script.
section.example: if busy end end if busy = .t.

section.description: When the user is leaving the object, add the following code to the OnDepart event script.
